title: Jan. 6 participant Ashli Babbitt's husband, conservative group file a wrongful death suit against U.S. government
description: A conservative group sued the U.S. government for $30 million over the alleged wrongful death of Ashli Babbitt who was killed by law enforcement on Jan. 6.

title: Right-wing Republicans threaten a shutdown over immigration, sparking backlash
description: Right-wing Republicans say they'll shut down the government unless President Joe Biden and the Democrats agree to tougher border laws to curtail migration.

title: Nordstrom deals to shop now
description: Nordstrom is offering up to 60% off on NBC Select editor-favorite brands like Our Place, Nike, Ugg and more.

title: Dermatologists weigh in on using diaper cream as moisturizer
description: Now trending on TikTok? Using diaper cream and face moisturizer. We asked dermatologists to weigh in on whether it really works.

title: Walmart sales to shop now
description: Walmart is currently offering sales on popular products like the Ninja Creami, Apple Airpods, LG televisions and more.

title: Supreme Court allows Idaho to enforce abortion law against emergency room doctors ahead of hearing case
description: The Supreme Court ruled on Idaho's bid to enforce provisions of a strict new abortion ban that could penalize doctors who perform the procedure in emergencies.

title: Supreme Court agrees to weigh whether Trump can be kicked off ballot in Colorado
description: The Supreme Court will consider whether Donald Trump could be deemed ineligible to run for office again because of his actions leading up to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol — a case that could have a seismic impact on the presidential election.

title: American rape suspect who allegedly faked own death and posed as a U.K. citizen is extradited back to the U.S.
description: An American who allegedly faked his own death to dodge a rape allegation in Utah was removed from the United Kingdom and is headed back the United States, officials said Friday.

title: December reader favorites: Face masks, travel accessories and more
description: The most purchased products we covered in December include humidifiers, neck creams and more from brands like Everlasting Comfort and Roc.

title: A Florida woman who has been in jail since 2022 is pregnant, prompting an investigation
description: A woman who has been in a Florida jail since 2022 is pregnant, according to her sister and her attorney, who are demanding answers from corrections officials.

title: TSA official accused of exploiting a family member with dementia is arrested at Atlanta airport
description: A high-ranking official with the Transportation Security Administration was arrested on charges stemming from her alleged involvement in the exploitation of a family member with dementia.

title: A new coronavirus variant has become dominant, but fewer people are being hospitalized this winter than last
description: The JN.1 coronavirus is now dominant, and CDC wastewater data suggests that Covid activity may have surpassed last winter’s. But hospitalizations remain lower.

title: Nikki Haley says she would 'maybe' consider Ron DeSantis as her running mate
description: Nikki Haley said she would consider Ron DeSantis as her running mate while saying she is not running to be Donald Trump's vice president in 2024.

title: Illinois man charged with parade shooting reverses decision to defend himself in court
description: Robert Crimo III, charged with shooting & killing 7 people at a 4th of July parade in Highland Park Illinois, will no longer represent himself at his trial

title: How online racism can hurt the mental health of Black youth
description: Online racism was linked to PTSD symptoms in Black teens, and PTSD symptoms are linked to suicidal thoughts. Mental health experts want to fight rising suicide rates in Black youth.

title: Microsoft and OpenAI sued for copyright infringement by nonfiction book authors in class action claim
description: Two nonfiction book authors sued Microsoft and OpenAI in a would-be class action complaint alleging that the defendants “simply stole” the writers’ copyrighted works to help build a billion-dollar artificial intelligence system.

title: California prosecutors charge father after his 10-year-old son allegedly fatally shot a child
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif. — Northern California prosecutors have decided to only charge the father of a 10-year-old boy in connection with the death of a child the boy allegedly shot.

title: 4.2 magnitude earthquake shakes Southern California
description: A 4.2 magnitude earthquake rattled Southern California on Friday morning, according to the U.S.

title: Aliens at a Miami mall? Police say 'lol'
description: Teens running, police converging and a grey splotch that appears to be moving: Videos from an outdoor mall in Miami stoked wild claims this week on social media that aliens had landed on Earth.

title: The best cable organizers of 2024
description: Organizing experts share their top tips and products to prevent cable cords, phone chargers, headphone cables and more from getting tangled.

title: Student loan repayment issues frustrate borrowers, prompting federal response
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said federsl student loan borrowers are facing "key concerns" in restarting payments.

title: Wayne LaPierre resigns as NRA leader, days before start of his civil trial
description: Wayne LaPierre resigned as leader of the National Rifle Association on Friday, ending his decadeslong reign over the prominent gun rights group, days before the start of his civil trial in New York.

title: Teen who beat Tetris gets a surprise meeting with game's creator
description: Being the first person to beat the original Tetris game would have been enough for 13-year-old Willis Gibson, a shy teen who spends hours every day piecing the virtual tiles together.

title: 13-year-old meets Tetris creator after beating original game
description: 13-year-old Willis Gibson, the first person to beat the original Tetris, is surprised by game creator Alexey Pajitnov during a Zoom interview with NBC News' Valerie Castro.

title: Steve Burton returning to ‘General Hospital’ after being fired for refusing Covid vaccine
description: Steve Burton will return to “General Hospital” after having been fired in November 2021 because of his refusal to get the Covid vaccine.

title: N.Y. AG calls for $370M fine against Trump and lifetime ban from real estate industry
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James is calling for a $370 million fine against former President Donald Trump and his companies and a lifetime ban for him and two of his former company executives from the real estate industry in the state.

title: Ohio governor signs executive order banning gender surgeries for minors
description: Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine issued an executive order immediately banning transition-related surgeries for minors.

title: The best Amazon deals right now
description: Get up to 50% off on toothpaste, mouthwash, mattresses and water bottles from brands like Colgate, Brita, Zinus and more.

title: PepsiCo products are being pulled from some grocery stores in Europe over price hikes
description: Global supermarket chain Carrefour will stop selling PepsiCo products in it stores in France, Belgium, Spain and Italy over price increases for popular items like Lay’s potato chips, Quaker Oats, Lipton tea and its namesake soda.

title: 'American Born Chinese' canceled after one season at Disney+
description: 'American Born Chinese,' starring Michelle Yeoh and Ke Huy Quan, has been canceled after one season at Disney+.

title: Northeast bracing for first major winter storm of the season
description: More than 30 million people are under winter alerts as the Northeast braces for its first significant winter storm of the season.

title: Shohei Ohtani and the Dodgers are donating to victims of Japan's earthquakes
description: Baseball star Shohei Ohtani and his new team, the Los Angeles Dodgers, are donating $1 million to victims of a series of earthquakes that shook Japan’s western coast on Monday.

title: Blaze leads to partial collapse of N.J. building that once housed the Singer sewing machine factory
description: Over 100 firefighters battled a blaze Friday at a New Jersey industrial park that was home to the Singer Sewing Machine factory for more than a century.

title: FDA to allow Florida to import prescription drugs in bulk from Canada
description: The FDA will allow Florida to import prescription drugs from Canada, a move intended to lower costs for residents in the state.

title: Iowa high school principal tried to 'distract' shooter so students could flee, daughter says
description: Perry High School principal Dan Marburger tried to calm down the shooter and "distract him" so students could flee, according to a Facebook post from his daughter, who said he was stable after getting shot.

title: Latino group sues banks and credit unions after denying loans to eligible DACA recipients
description: Latino civil rights organization MALDEF has sued  financial institutions for allegedly discriminating against DACA recipients by denying them loans and other services based on their immigration status.

title: U.S. readies aid as death toll from Japan earthquake nears 100
description: The U.S. said it was preparing military logistical support and aid for regions in Japan devastated by an earthquake that killed 94 people.

title: Former Colorado Officer Randy Roedema, convicted of killing Elijah McClain, to be sentenced
description: A former Colorado police officer convicted of killing Black pedestrian Elijah McClain is set to face a judge on Friday afternoon to learn if he's going to prison.

title: David Soul, actor best known for his role in the TV series 'Starsky & Hutch,' dies at 80
description: David Soul, an actor who rocketed to fame in the 1970s as the blond half of the TV crime-fighting duo "Starsky and Hutch" and went on to become a successful pop singer, has died.

title: Neri Oxman, billionaire investor Bill Ackman’s wife, accused of plagiarism in MIT dissertation
description: Billionaire investor Bill Ackman has been a vocal critic of Harvard’s recently-resigned president Claudine Gay over allegations of plagiarism and her handling of antisemitism on campus. Now his wife, Neri Oxman, has been accused of similar plagiarism.

title: Weight loss drugs Ozempic and Wegovy may not increase thoughts of suicide
description: Despite anecdotes of suicidal thoughts linked to weight loss drugs, research finds little evidence of negative mental health effects linked to Ozempic and Wegovy.

title: House Republicans move toward holding Hunter Biden in contempt of Congress
description: House Republicans are prepared to move forward with a resolution to hold Hunter Biden in contempt of Congress for defying their subpoena.

title: Florida abortion rights groups collect enough signatures to advance ballot measure
description: A proposed amendment to enshrine access to abortion in Florida’s constitution moved one step closer to appearing on the November 2024 ballot.

title: Biden speaks at Valley Forge ahead of Jan. 6 anniversary
description: Watch live coverage as President Biden travels to Valley Forge in Pennsylvania to deliver a speech marking the anniversary of the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.

title: Tesla recalls over 1.6M EVs exported to China to fix automatic steering and door latch glitches
description: BEIJING — Tesla is recalling more than 1.6 million Model S, X, 3 and Y electric vehicles exported to China for problems with their automatic assisted steering and door latch controls.

title: 'Speed Racer' actor and 2 young daughters killed in Caribbean plane crash
description: A Hollywood actor and his two young daughters are feared dead after four bodies were recovered from a plane that crashed into the sea off a Caribbean island Thursday.

title: Northeast could see first significant snow of the year
description: An approaching winter storm is expected to deliver ice and snow from the Carolinas to New England. NBC meteorologist Angie Lassman reports on where the weather could be the worst.

title: The U.S. added 216,000 jobs in December, much better than expected
description: The U.S. labor market closed out 2023 in strong shape as the pace of hiring was even more powerful than expected, the Labor Department reported Friday.

title: Once laughed off by Elon Musk, China's BYD has taken Tesla's EV crown
description: BYD dethroned Tesla in the fourth quarter as the top EV maker, selling more battery-powered vehicles than its U.S. rival.

title: Dog eats $4,000 in cash off the counter. The unpleasant way his owners got it back
description: The dog eating your homework is a story as old as time.

title: Biden falls behind Trump's pace on confirming judges as he enters a fourth year in office
description: President Joe Biden has fallen behind Donald Trump's pace in confirming new judges.

title: What’s in the second batch of Jeffrey Epstein documents?
description: A second batch of court documents connected to Jeffrey Epstein was unsealed, revealing primarily depositions transcripts, court filings and emails. NBC’s Laura Jarrett reports for TODAY.

title: Donald Trump's Jan. 6 defense and the Stanley Quencher cup craze: Morning Rundown
description: Why Donald Trump’s lawyers won’t be able to rely on the same arguments other lawyers have made on behalf of Jan. 6 rioters.

title: Man who lost a leg after being stuck in a mangled car for days thanks the kindness of strangers
description: An Indiana man whose leg was amputated after he was rescued from a mangled car under an interstate bridge after 6 days has praised the outpouring of kindness he's received since his accident.

title: Why Trump can't use the 'idiot' defense other Jan. 6 defendants often lean on
description: While other Jan. 6 defendants and their lawyers have argued that they participated in the Capitol riot due to stupidity, Donald Trump would have a hard time succeeding with that argument in court.

title: Former Capitol Police officer outspoken about Jan. 6 launches run for Congress
description: Former Capitol Police officer Harry Dunn who has spoken about Jan. 6 announces he'll run for Congress in Maryland's 3rd Congressional District as a Democrat.

title: Young voters in Bangladesh dream future free from political chaos as nation goes to vote
description: Incumbent Bangladesh leader Sheikh Hasina is seeking a fourth consecutive term after elections marred by allegations of vote-rigging and intimidation.

title: Biden to argue Trump remains a threat to democracy — a case his campaign thinks resonates with voters
description: President Joe Biden is kicking off the election year by setting his focus squarely on what he sees as the threat to democracy posed by Donald Trump.

title: Chuck Todd: Confronting Trump
description: Chuck Todd: The Trump era shows that frontal confrontation, not bank-shot attacks, are the way to deal with Trump. But the lesson hasn’t sunk in everywhere.

title: Pilot accused of threatening to shoot airline captain midflight calls it a misunderstanding
description: Attorneys clashed Thursday in a Utah courtroom over opposing characterizations of a fight between two commercial airline pilots in which the co-pilot allegedly threatened to shoot the captain.

title: North Korea fires artillery shells toward South's border island; evacuations ordered
description: North Korea fired artillery shells near the disputed sea boundary off South Korea's western coast, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said Friday.

title: Neo-Nazi podcasters sent to prison on terror charges for targeting Prince Harry and his young son
description: A neo-Nazi podcaster who called for the deaths of Prince Harry and his young son received a prison sentence Thursday along with his co-host Thursday.

title: Israel lays out plans for the next stage of its Gaza war
description: Israel lays out plans for the next stage of its Gaza war

title: Oscar Pistorius, disgraced Olympic sprinter, released from South African prison after killing girlfriend
description: Disgraced Olympic sprinter Oscar Pistorius was released from a South African prison on parole Friday, nearly 11 years after the Valentine's Day slaying of his girlfriend.

title: Florida man who fled before Jan. 6 sentencing gets 10 years in prison
description: A Florida man who fled after being convicted in a Jan. 6 case, triggering a six-week manhunt, was sentenced to 10 years in prison Thursday, federal prosecutors said.

title: A Peloton instructor complained that a Christopher Nolan movie was a waste of time. Then, Nolan took the class.
description: In 2020, Peloton instructor Jenn Sherman sat on her stationary workout bike and faced an empty studio, dumbbells in hand, as a bass-heavy beat blared in the background.

title: Body found in San Diego home's freezer may be woman missing for 9 years, police say
description: The body found in a San Diego freezer last month may have been that of a woman who has been missing or dead for up to nine years, the San Diego Police Department said.

title: 'The only thing left to do': Trump campaign turns its fire on Nikki Haley to blunt her rise
description: Trump allies say his campaign’s decision to begin hammering Nikki Haley reflects a new dynamic in the Republican presidential race: She's now in the No. 2 spot.

title: Black women at Harvard say Claudine Gay’s ouster reflects a system that wasn’t built for them
description: Black women students at Harvard say Claudine Gay's resignation is a “disappointing” reminder of the ways they are undermined, no matter how high they ascend.

title: Latest Jeffrey Epstein document release continues to keep online conspiracy theorists invested
description: Newly released documents from a settled lawsuit involving the late financier Jeffrey Epstein held few new details, but that hasn’t stopped social media users from speculating about high-profile names found in the pages.

title: Former Guatemalan president leaves prison for first time since 2015 after posting bond
description: Former Guatemalan President Otto Pérez Molina was released from prison — the first time since his resignation and arrest in 2015 — after posting bond.

title: Pair indicted in alleged Airbnb, Vrbo rental property scam that netted $8.5 million
description: Two men accused of racking up more than $8.5 million in a scam run on vacation rental sites Airbnb and Vrbo were indicted on fraud charges, federal prosecutors announced Thursday.

title: Sixth grader killed, five others injured at school shooting in Perry, Iowa
description: A junior at a high school in Perry, Iowa killed a sixth grader and wounded five others in a school shooting. Police say the gunman was killed by a self-inflicted wound. NBC News’ Vaughn Hillyard has more details on the tragic incident.
